baseOffenseQuestions.text: Has the substantive offense that was the object of the attempt, solicitation, or conspiracy been identified?

noResult.description: Default base offense level when substantive offense cannot be identified

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Can any intended offense conduct beyond the basic substantive offense be established with reasonable certainty?

noResult.description: Base offense level from the guideline for the substantive offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Are there specific adjustments in the substantive offense guideline that apply to the intended offense conduct that can be established with reasonable certainty?

yesResult.description: Base offense level from the substantive offense guideline plus applicable adjustments for intended offense conduct established with reasonable certainty

noResult.description: Base offense level from the guideline for the substantive offense

yesEffect.description: Decrease by 3 levels for attempt, unless defendant completed all acts believed necessary or was about to complete them but for apprehension/interruption
yesEffect.condition: Does not apply if defendant completed all acts believed necessary for successful completion or circumstances demonstrate defendant was about to complete all such acts but for apprehension or interruption by some similar event beyond defendant's control

yesEffect.description: Decrease by 3 levels for conspiracy, unless defendant or co-conspirator completed all acts believed necessary or was about to complete them but for apprehension/interruption
yesEffect.condition: Does not apply if defendant or co-conspirator completed all acts conspirators believed necessary for successful completion or circumstances demonstrate conspirators were about to complete all such acts but for apprehension or interruption by some similar event beyond their control

options.label: Yes, but statute treats solicitation identically with substantive offense
options.description: No reduction applies when statute treats solicitation same as substantive offense

options.label: Yes, and standard solicitation reduction applies
options.description: Decrease by 3 levels for solicitation, unless person solicited completed all acts believed necessary or was about to complete them but for apprehension/interruption
options.condition: Does not apply if person solicited completed all acts he believed necessary for successful completion or circumstances demonstrate person was about to complete all such acts but for apprehension or interruption by some similar event beyond such person's control

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the conduct limited to harboring a fugitive (and not involving other accessory conduct)?
Does the case fall under subdivision (C) (special harboring cases)?

yesResult.description: Harboring fugitive - special case under subdivision (C)

noResult.baseLevel: 6 levels lower than underlying offense (min 4, max 20)

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the underlying offense level high enough that 6 levels lower would exceed level 30?
Is the underlying offense level low enough that 6 levels lower would be less than level 4?

noResult.description: Standard calculation: 6 levels below underlying offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense level for the underlying offense 23 or higher?

yesResult.description: 9 levels lower than underlying offense, capped at maximum of 19

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense level for the underlying offense 13 or higher?

noResult.description: 9 levels lower than underlying offense, but minimum of 4 applies

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the calculated level (underlying offense level minus 9) at least 4?

yesResult.description: 9 levels lower than the underlying offense level

noResult.description: 9 levels lower than underlying offense, but minimum of 4 applies

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted of conduct described in 18 U.S.C. § 1841(a)(1) and listed in 18 U.S.C. § 1841?

yesResult.description: Apply the guideline that covers the specific conduct the defendant is convicted of having engaged in, as described in 18 U.S.C. § 1841(a)(1) and listed in 18 U.S.C. § 1841

noResult.description: Section 2X5.1 does not apply - defendant not convicted of conduct under 18 U.S.C. § 1841

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1841(a)(1)?

yesResult.description: Apply the Chapter Two offense guideline that covers the specific conduct the defendant is convicted of having engaged in (the conduct that violates a specific provision listed in 18 U.S.C. § 1841)

noResult.description: This guideline section does not apply - defendant not convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1841(a)(1)

2X6.1.title: Use of a Minor in a Crime of Violence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted of using a minor to commit a crime of violence under 18 U.S.C. § 25?
Has the offense level for the underlying crime of violence been determined?

yesResult.description: 4 plus the offense level from the guideline applicable to the underlying crime of violence

noResult.description: 4 plus the offense level from the guideline applicable to the underlying crime of violence (underlying offense level must be determined)

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 555(c)?
Is the offense level (4 plus the underlying smuggling offense level) less than level 16?

yesResult.description: 18 U.S.C. § 555(c) with calculated level less than 16

noResult.description: 18 U.S.C. § 555(c) - 4 plus underlying smuggling offense level

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 555(a)?
Was the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 555?

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve any of the following conduct with the submersible or semi-submersible vessel?

options.label: Failure to heave to when directed by law enforcement officers
